column4: i have this board http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813188035 with a NVIDIA nForce 730i northbridge that supports raid 5, is there a way to do hardware raid 5 with this and if so is there somewhere i can read on how to do this
No, it's software RAID5, not true hardware driven. You're better off using mdadm and disabling the BIOS RAID settings.
you mean my board only supports raid 5 software? or ubuntu does
Your board. I have the same northbridge. They say it's 'RAID capable' because it can transmit to all the SATA ports simultaneously.
But there's no hardware RAID driver. It has to be software driven.
Actually, I've been running a RAID5 array for 3 years and haven't lost a single file.
yeah i looked at mdadm and it looks easy to get going
And I've worked with it. Swapped 2 drives, expanded from 3 to 5 disks, and never even had a hiccup.
Yea, it's pretty simple. Personally, I liked the way LVM worked on top of RAID. Let me find the howto I used to set it up for you.
guess im stuck w/ software raid
well how do i know if a board has software as opposed to hardware
